intro: Hapalochilus stabilis, commonly known as the stable hapalochilus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Hapalochilus stabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
